results.title: Pantomime - Fairy Tale Theatre
results.brief_description: This program takes a look at the magical world of pantomime, both on the stage and behind it, and meets some of the artists who have made panto their life’s work.

results.title: Panorama: cancer
results.brief_description: Discusses the nature of cancer, the facts which research has revealed and stresses the need to intensify clinical research. Prevention is important and must be publicised particularly the need to reduce smoking. Suggests forming a central international clearing house for data on cancer to speed its control.

results.title: Pandora's box
results.brief_description: A delightful experiment in social satire. A large box floats into view, then begins to revolve and change shape. Doors open and close to reveal quick snatches in color of zooming airplanes, TV commercials, silent movies, a mouth spouting gobbledygook, and, finally a loop of film which is eaten by the box in one gulp. Is the box our world?

results.title: Pancho
results.brief_description: From the book written and illustrated by Berta and Elmer Hader, this animated story tells of a young Mexican boy, Pancho, who unexpectedly becomes a hero when he captures a bull.

results.title: Pan-Pacific jamboree
results.creator_credit: Australian Commonwealth Film Unit and Herschells Films
results.brief_description: Presents a scout’s account of activities at an International Boy Scout Jamboree held near Melbourne. He mentions the friends he makes, demonstrates folk dancing given by groups of scouts, daily chores, the big parade and popular past-times such as autograph hunting.

results.title: Palace Cafe
results.creator_credit: Andrew Lancaster, Murray Fahey and AFTRS
results.brief_description: The Palace Cafe, a place where solitary drinkers sip their cappuccinos, read their newspapers and nothing much else happens. The cafe becomes alive one night when a lonely man spots an attractive woman across the room and staff and patrons burst into dance, choreographing their moves to the tune of the lonely man’s imagination.

results.title: Paintings need care
results.brief_description: English version by J.L. Levi-Alvares. Set to the background music of Handel, J.C.Bach and Vivaldi, this film illustrates how paintings stored in the National Museum of Warsaw which have been damaged by time or during wartime occupation of Poland, are restored. It shows the careful and painstaking skills required to once again allow these paintings to take their rightful place on the walls of the Museum.
